question: Which has a stronger effect on brain volume and memory: aerobic exercise or resistance training?
generated_answer: Aerobic exercise has a stronger effect on brain volume and memory compared to resistance training. Additionally, research from the University of Jyväskylä in Finland demonstrated that rats undergoing aerobic exercise had significantly more new hippocampal neurons than sedentary counterparts In contrast, resistance training, while beneficial for muscle strength and overall health, does not have the same impact on brain volume and memory as aerobic exercise. A study comparing aerobic exercise to resistance training found that only sustained aerobic exercise improved hippocampal neurogenesis in adult animals Therefore, for enhancing brain volume and memory, aerobic exercise is more effective than resistance training
ground_truth_answer: Aerobic exercise has a stronger effect on brain volume and memory compared to resistance training. According to the documents, regular aerobic exercise could boost the size of the hippocampus (a brain region critical to learning and memory), while resistance training, muscle toning, and balance exercises did not have the same results. This is supported by evidence showing that cardiovascular fitness and aerobic exercise training are associated with greater brain volume in several brain regions, including the hippocampus, parietal, frontal, prefrontal, and subgenual cortices.
